metadata.ttm:title: Subcontracting Plan Mod Overview
metadata.ttm:desc: A Subcontracting Plan is required on a Contract under certain circumstances. The Incorporate Sub-Contracting Plan (SubK) Modification allows Contractors to add a Subcontracting Plan to their Contract Offer as required. Generally, Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) require a Subcontracting Plan from a Contractor classified as "Other than Small Business" when the actual Sales of a Contract exceed the $650,000 threshold, (or the $1,500,000 threshold for construction).

div.p: A Sub-Contracting Plan is required on a Contract
under certain situations.
Generally, the Federal Acquisition Regulations
(FAR) require a subcontracting plan from a
Contractor classified as "Other than Small
Business" when the actual sales of a contract exceed
the $650,000 threshold (for contracts awarded on
or after October 1, 2010) or the $550,000 threshold
(for contracts awarded prior to October 1, 2010).
In such a case an informational message will
appear on the 'MY MODIFICATIONS' page as
shown here.
Create a sub-Contracting Mod by selecting the
Contract and click Select Contract.
Select the sub type Incorporate
Sub-Contracting Plan (SubK) and click the
Submit Online button at the bottom of the page.
Verify your corporate information.
Click "Continue" on the information saved screen.
You will be presented with the options for the
creation or upload of your subcontracting plan.
If you already have a subcontracting plan,
choose from the first set of options which will
allow you to upload either a Master, or Commercial
Plan.
If you do not have a subcontracting plan, the
second option will guide you through the steps to
create one.
Commercial Plans cover a vendor's fiscal year and
applies to the entire production of commercial
items sold by either the entire company or a
portion there of.
It applies both for commercial and government
business and affects all government contracts in
the applicable year.
Individual Plans cover an entire contract period and
apply to one contract specifically.
Select either "Individual Plan" or "Commercial Plan"
then click "Save Plan Type."
With your selection made, you will now be able to
work through each section of the Subcontracting Plan
by clicking the respective "Respond" buttons.
You will find videos on each section of plan
creation.
